questionText: What tower was the tallest structure in the world when it opened in 1889 for the World's Fair?
What building was the tallest freestanding structure in the world from its completion in 1975 until 2009?
What is the tallest mountain in Japan?
What natural feature did Annie Edson Taylor go over in a barrel in 1901, becoming the first person to do so?
What is the current home of the British Crown Jewels?
What is the only one of the seven wonders of the ancient world that remains standing?
What is the highly photographed and filmed bridge painted a color called International Orange and named after the strait it crosses?
Where would you have gone to watch gladiator battles approximately 1900 years ago?
What is the highest mountain above sea level in the world?
What statue did France gift to the American people on July 4, 1884?
What iconic performing arts venue, known for its distinctive sail-like design, was designed by Danish architect JÃ¸rn Utzon?
What ancient temple was dedicated to the goddess Athena and is considered one of the most important surviving buildings of Classical antiquity?
What renowned chapel is famous for its ceiling painted by Michelangelo and serves as the site of the papal conclave?
What prehistoric monument consists of a ring of standing stones and is believed to have been constructed around 3000 BC to 2000 BC?
Which museum is the home of the Mona Lisa?
What famous commercial and entertainment hub is known for its bright lights, electronic billboards, and as the site of the annual New Year's Eve ball drop?
What historic castle sits on top of Castle Rock and overlooks a capital city?
What is the highest mountain in Africa?
What famous freestanding bell tower is known for its unintended tilt?
What famous palace was a principal royal residence from 1682 until the start of the French Revolution in 1789?
What historic site is known as the location where Guglielmo Marconi received the first transatlantic wireless signal?
What iconic landmark, originally created as an advertisement for a real estate development, has become a symbol of the American film industry?
What large Canadian glacier-fed lake, known for its stunning turquoise waters and mountainous surroundings, is visited by up to 15,000 people a day in the summer?
What is currently the tallest building in the world?
What famous landmark is an Art Deco statue of Christ with outstretched arms that stands on top of a mountain?
What famous geyser is known for its highly predictable eruptions, attracting tourists with its regular display of boiling water and steam?
What is the famous Gothic cathedral known for its twin towers and rose window that also featured as the setting for a novel by Victor Hugo?
What historic palace complex, once home to emperors and their households, is renowned for its extensive gardens, grand halls, and elaborate architecture?
